## Load Packages
```{r load packages, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(tidyr)
library(forcats)
library(ggplot2)
library(leaflet)
library(DT)
library(scales)

```

## Read Data
```{r load data}
escapement <- read_csv("https://knb.ecoinformatics.org/knb/d1/mn/v2/object/urn%3Auuid%3Af119a05b-bbe7-4aea-93c6-85434dcb1c5e")
```

## Explore Data
```{r explore data}

colnames(escapement)

glimpse(escapement)

range(escapement$sampleDate)

head(escapement)

unique(escapement$Species)


```

## Getting our data ready to plot

```{r cleaning}

annual_esc <- escapement %>% 
  separate(sampleDate, c("Year", "Month", "Day"), sep = "-") %>% 
  mutate(Year = as.numeric(Year)) %>% 
  group_by(Species, SASAP.Region, Year) %>% 
  summarize(escape = sum(DailyCount)) %>% 
  filter(Species %in% c("Chinook", "Sockeye", "Chum", "Coho", "Pink"))
  
unique(annual_esc$Species)
head(annual_esc)


```

## Plotting with `ggplot`

## Essencial components
```{r essencial}
## Option 1
ggplot(data = annual_esc,
       aes(x = Species,
           y = escape))+
  geom_col()

## Option 2 
ggplot(data = annual_esc)+
  geom_col(aes(x = Species,
               y = escape)) 

## Option 3
ggplot()+
  geom_col(data = annual_esc,
           aes(x = Species,
               y = escape))
```

## Different geoms

**Boxplot**
```{r}

annual_esc %>% 
  filter(Year == 1974, 
         Species %in% c("Chum", "Pink")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Species,
             y = escape))+
  geom_boxplot()

```

**Line and point**

```{r}
annual_esc %>% 
  filter(Species == "Sockeye",
         SASAP.Region == "Bristol Bay") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Year,
             y = escape))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()
```

### Custominzing our plot
fill = blue inside the aes function 
```{r}
ggplot(annual_esc,
       aes(x = Species,
           y = escape,
           fill = "blue"))+
  geom_col()
```

fill = "blue" outside of the `aes()`

```{r}
ggplot(annual_esc,
       aes(x = Species,
           y = escape,))+
  geom_col(fill = "blue")
```

Adding colors by region

```{r}
ggplot(annual_esc,
       aes(x = Species,
           y = escape, 
           fill = SASAP.Region))+
  geom_col()
```


### Creating multiple plots 

Subset data 

```{r subset}
annual_esc_2000 <- annual_esc %>% 
  filter(Year %in% c(2000:2016))

## quick check 
unique(annual_esc_2000$Year)
```

Plot with `facet_wrap()`

```{r faceting}

ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
  facet_wrap(~SASAP.Region, 
             scales = "free_y")
```

### Setting ggplot themes 

`theme_*()` function
```{r themes}
ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
  facet_wrap(~SASAP.Region, 
             scales = "free_y")+
  theme_bw()+
  ylab("Escapement")+
  ggtitle("Annual Salmon Escapement by Region")
```

```{r adding themes}
ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
  facet_wrap(~SASAP.Region, 
             scales = "free_y")+
  theme_bw()+
  ylab("Escapement")+
  ggtitle("Annual Salmon Escapement by Region")
```

Removing legend title and moving to bottom of plot
```{r legend}

ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
  facet_wrap(~SASAP.Region, 
             scales = "free_y")+
  theme_bw()+
  ylab("Escapement")+
  ggtitle("Annual Salmon Escapement by Region")+
  theme(legend.position = "bottom", 
        legend.title = element_blank())


```

### Saving theme into an object 
```{r saving theme}

my_theme <- theme_bw()+
  theme(legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank())
```

Creating plot with saved theme 

```{r}
ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
  facet_wrap(~SASAP.Region,
             scales = "free_y")+
  ylab("Escapement")+
  ggtitle("Annual Salmon Escapement by Region")+
  my_theme
```

Creating a plot with a y axis label angled and breaks x axis by 2

```{r angled years}
 
ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species)) +
    geom_line() +
    geom_point() +
    scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2000, 2016, 2)) +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
    facet_wrap( ~ SASAP.Region,
                scales = "free_y") +
    ylab("Escapement") +
    ggtitle("Annual Salmon Escapement by Region") +
    my_theme +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45,
                                     vjust = 0.5))

```

Smarter ticks using `scales()`

```{r}
###creating a plot as object annual_region_plot <- ggplot.....(1st line)
annual_region_plot <- ggplot(annual_esc_2000,
       aes(x = Year,
           y = escape,
           color = Species)) +
    geom_line() +
    geom_point() +
    scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2000, 2016, 2)) +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = comma)+
    facet_wrap( ~ SASAP.Region,
                scales = "free_y") +
    ylab("Escapement") +
    ggtitle("Annual Salmon Escapement by Region") +
    my_theme +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45,
                                     vjust = 0.5))
```

### Saving plot

```{r saving}

ggsave("figs/annual_esc_region.png", annual_region_plot, width = 12, height = 8, units = "in")

```


## Maps with `leaflet`

Subset location information
```{r}
location <- escapement %>% 
  distinct(Location, Latitude, Longitude) %>% 
  drop_na()

```

Create map with `leaflet()`

```{r}
leaflet(location) %>% 
  addTiles() %>% 
  addMarkers(lng = ~Longitude,
             lat = ~Latitude,
             popup = ~Location)
```

Map with different basemap 
```{r}
leaflet(location) %>%
    addWMSTiles(
        "https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gebco_web_services/web_map_service/mapserv?request=getmap&service=wms&BBOX=-90,-180,90,360&crs=EPSG:4326&format=image/jpeg&layers=gebco_latest&width=1200&height=600&version=1.3.0",
        layers = 'GEBCO_LATEST',
        attribution = "Imagery reproduced from the GEBCO_2022 Grid, WMS 1.3.0 GetMap, www.gebco.net"
    ) %>%
    addCircleMarkers(
        lng = ~ Longitude,
        lat = ~ Latitude,
        popup = ~ Location,
        radius = 5,
        # set fill properties
        fillColor = "salmon",
        fillOpacity = 1,
        # set stroke properties
        stroke = T,
        weight = 0.5,
        color = "white",
        opacity = 1
    )
```
